issue.title: Help Reconstructing Smooth Objects
issue.body: ### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware Pulled from openMVG and openMVS repo two weeks back Ubuntu 18 Hardware - Cameras in fixed position; object places on white background / floor; photos taken from multiple angles (angles are always the same due to fixed setup) ### Steps to reproduce the problem Objects with smooth surfaces are not getting reconstructed correctly. Firstly, I'll admit I only have high level understanding of the full openMVG + openMVS process - msot of the math goes above my head. ### What I Am Trying To Do: Reconstruct a soft drink bottle from 80 photos. Using script mentioned here for end to end reconsturction. ### What Is My Problem: Output is not good, especially the portions where surfaces are plain. ### What I Have Tried: Placing some markers on the rotating floor to help differentiate each pose. Output mesh still has lot of holes. ### Questions: 1) Is there a way I can do the mesh creation and texture creation from different data sets ? I have considered maybe marking the bottle so its not plain, have the mesh created correctly, then have the system use different set of images (assume the poses will be direct one to one mapping between both data sets) so they can be textured correctly. I have no idea how to do this. 2) Can I use a highly textured object to reconsturct a mesh, use the known poses of the camera for the new object (I know I can use the StructureFromKnownPoses for this, will have to figure out workflow) ? Will this improve the texture of smooth surfaced objects ? 3) Will having just newspapers on the ground matter for the textures of plain surfaces on the object ? Any other suggestions on how to do this would also be greatly appreciated. Also, please let me know if it makes more sense to have this discussion on the openMVG repo. Screenshot of output - ![Frooti](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10094226/73934955-80a23680-4905-11ea-9d37-967a077723d0.jpeg)

issue.title: Releasing OpenMVS under GPL?
issue.body:
Followup on issues/268

Is it possible to release openMVS under a less restrictive license than AGPL, e.g. GPL?
We would like to use and contribute to the openMVS pipeline. But the AGPL license is very restrictive for us. 

Thanks

comment.body: Thank you for the explanation. In this case I have trouble understanding your intentions. On one hand you say you can not run modified version on your internal servers, but on the other you want to contribute to OpenMVS with your changes. So my understanding is as soon as you make your changes part of OpenMVS, you are free to run it on your internal servers. Pls explain what is blocking you?

comment.body: no, since the cameras do not move with respect of eachother, you can compute their position once, very accurate, using a calibration technique, like checkerboard, etc

Thank you for the suggestions.

By "calibrate your fixed camera setup before" are you referring to 1) Use a highly textured object 2) Use ConvertSfMDataFormat to get the json 3) Use that json for the new run ?

I will take the other suggestions and see if they improve the result in the meantime, thanks again.

issue.title: Releasing OpenMVS under GPL?
issue.body:
Followup on issues/268

Is it possible to release openMVS under a less restrictive license than AGPL, e.g. GPL?
We would like to use and contribute to the openMVS pipeline. But the AGPL license is very restrictive for us. 

Thanks

comment.body:
Actually AGPL is protecting the project better than GPL.
See https://choosealicense.com/licenses/gpl-3.0/ vs. https://choosealicense.com/licenses/agpl-3.0/
AGPL-> Protect the project towards running a modified version on servers.

Can you list what is problematic for you with the AGPL, an example to understand what is blocking you would be nice?

issue.title: The Viewer process is still alive after closing the window
issue.body:
### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware
Linux Ubuntu 19.10 & OpenMVS master

### Steps to reproduce the problem
1. Launch Viewer from command line
2. Close the window
3. Terminal doesn't get prompt back until Ctrl+C is pressed

issue.title: Viewer fails to display the texture of the obj model
issue.body:
I have encountered with the problem of displaying the textures, while the viewer logs tells all the needed files were loaded successfully, including .obj of 5.4 GB, .mtl of  173 bytes and .jpg of 93.7 MB.
The Viewer module works normally when displaying .obj with a small .jpg textures images, is there any restricts setting about the texture image?
![Screenshot from 2020-01-07 22-28-04](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25864947/71902557-49712600-319d-11ea-98b0-1394193ef176.png)

issue.title: Help Reconstructing Smooth Objects
issue.body: ### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware Pulled from openMVG and openMVS repo two weeks back Ubuntu 18 Hardware - Cameras in fixed position; object places on white background / floor; photos taken from multiple angles (angles are always the same due to fixed setup) ### Steps to reproduce the problem Objects with smooth surfaces are not getting reconstructed correctly. Firstly, I'll admit I only have high level understanding of the full openMVG + openMVS process - msot of the math goes above my head. ### What I Am Trying To Do: Reconstruct a soft drink bottle from 80 photos. Using script mentioned here for end to end reconsturction. ### What Is My Problem: Output is not good, especially the portions where surfaces are plain. ### What I Have Tried: Placing some markers on the rotating floor to help differentiate each pose. Output mesh still has lot of holes. ### Questions: 1) Is there a way I can do the mesh creation and texture creation from different data sets ? I have considered maybe marking the bottle so its not plain, have the mesh created correctly, then have the system use different set of images (assume the poses will be direct one to one mapping between both data sets) so they can be textured correctly. I have no idea how to do this. 2) Can I use a highly textured object to reconsturct a mesh, use the known poses of the camera for the new object (I know I can use the StructureFromKnownPoses for this, will have to figure out workflow) ? Will this improve the texture of smooth surfaced objects ? 3) Will having just newspapers on the ground matter for the textures of plain surfaces on the object ? Any other suggestions on how to do this would also be greatly appreciated. Also, please let me know if it makes more sense to have this discussion on the openMVG repo. Screenshot of output - ![Frooti](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10094226/73934955-80a23680-4905-11ea-9d37-967a077723d0.jpeg)

comment.body:
As of today, photogrammetry has intrinsics limitations when it comes to textureless/transparent areas or specular/glossy surfaces. If that is your use case and you know you have a fixed setup you should seek to use a structured light setup that mitigates some of these issues.

If still want to use photogrammetry, then make sure the input data is extremely good:
- high resolution, sharp, clean (no noise) images
- good and constant illumination
- high image overlap (~80%)
- calibrate your fixed camera setup before

If you do all above right, you will get decent results even with a photogrammetry pipeline.

issue.title: DensifyPointCloud / error: failed loading image header / failing at jpeg_create_decompress
issue.body:
### Specifications like the version of the project, operating system, and hardware

CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-8259U CPU @ 2.30GHz (8 cores)
RAM: 8.00GB Physical Memory 8.00GB Virtual Memory
OS: Darwin 18.7.0 (x86_64)

opencv: 4.2.0
libjpeg: 9d

### Steps to reproduce the problem

I am trying to run the sample dataset from [openMVS_sample](https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS_sample) with: 
```
DensifyPointCloud scene.mvs
```

The output I got:
```
19:39:58 [App     ] Build date: Feb  4 2020, 18:41:47
19:39:58 [App     ] CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-8259U CPU @ 2.30GHz (8 cores)
19:39:58 [App     ] RAM: 8.00GB Physical Memory 8.00GB Virtual Memory
19:39:58 [App     ] OS: Darwin 18.7.0 (x86_64)
19:39:58 [App     ] SSE & AVX compatible CPU & OS detected
19:39:58 [App     ] Command line: scene.mvs
19:39:58 [App     ] Camera model loaded: platform 0; camera  0; f 1.054x1.054; poses 11
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   0: 00000.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   1: 00001.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   2: 00002.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   3: 00003.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   4: 00004.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   5: 00005.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   6: 00006.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   7: 00007.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   8: 00008.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded   9: 00009.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Image loaded  10: 00010.jpg
19:39:58 [App     ] Scene loaded from interface format (9ms):
	11 images (11 calibrated) with a total of 63.22 MPixels (5.75 MPixels/image)
	12683 points, 0 vertices, 0 faces
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00008.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00004.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00006.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00010.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00002.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00007.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed loading image header
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00009.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: failed reloading image '/Users/gdl/openMVS_sample/images/00000.jpg'
19:39:58 [App     ] error: preparing images for dense reconstruction failed (errors loading images)
```
I dug around and it seems like `jpeg_create_decompress` in `libs/IO/ImageJPG.cpp` is failing without any error messages.

### Possibly related:
#258: both uses libjpeg 9d.
#402: I tried both executing with `-w`/ in the directory where `scene.mvs` is saved. 

Could someone kindly give me some guidance on how to approch this? 😇
Thanks in advance!

comment.body:
Thanks for your quick reply!

I confirmed that both openMVS and opencv are using the same JPEG lib from their cmake outputs:
openMVS:
```
-- Found JPEG: /usr/local/lib/libjpeg.dylib (found version "80") 
```

opencv:
```
JPEG:                /usr/local/lib/libjpeg.dylib (ver 80)
```
Could any other part of the library be compiled with a different JPEG version?

I dug around and it seems like `jpeg_create_decompress` in `libs/IO/ImageJPG.cpp` is failing without any error messages.

### Possibly related:
#258: both uses libjpeg 9d.
#402: I tried both executing with `-w`/ in the directory where `scene.mvs` is saved. 

Could someone kindly give me some guidance on how to approch this? 😇
Thanks in advance!

comment.body: I saw this issue before many times and the problem as always a conflict of JPEG lib version (parts of the code are compile with some version and then linked statically to other parts of the code compiled with other version).
